message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.MM 

The paper deals with reliable communication in vehicular networks, which involves information theory (cs.IT) and network infrastructure (cs.NI). The use of an Arbitrarily Varying Channel (AVC) and the study of symmetrizability and invertibility of the corresponding channel matrix suggest a systems and control (cs.SY) perspective. The introduction of block-restricted jamming and the analysis of its maximum error capacity relate to computer security and cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the application of the results to vehicular communication implies a potential connection to multimedia (cs.MM) for the transmission of audio and video data.
